title: Ticket #6707: Fix handling of missing local config files
description:
When initializing Condor's config system, the caller can pass a flag that suppresses calls to exit() on errors. When this flag (CONFIG_OPT_NO_EXIT) is used, the initialization call returns false instead of calling exit(). This flag is doesn't affect the case where a required local config file is missing or unreadable. These errors do result in a call to exit() (except when using config_host() with a non-NULL host argument). This flag also doesn't affect parse errors, like a missing '=', which always cause an exit().

The use of CONFIG_OPT_NO_EXIT is dubious. If config_ex() returns false, then much of the initialization of the config system hasn't been done. The caller should abort or try to fix the problem and call config_ex() again. All current callers proceed as if config_ex() was successful.
